page.title: 18OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES
page.content: As this area is predominantly fell country, walking and rambling are increasingly popular pursuits involving both local people and visitors. The high, wild rocky country of the fells, with their short, rough grass covering and open aspect makes them ideal for high and low-level walking as well as for fell-running. Cavers, hydrologists and geologists are attracted by the varied rocks, tumbling streams, small potholes and caves. There is an outdoor specialist shop in Sedbergh as well as several field study centres in the area which have recently been set up. Nine miles away in Dent there is Whernside Manor, the national caving centre.
